Node.definition: = process by which an action is repeated or continued
= man; ◄ son of Barachel (בַּרַכְאֵל) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which an event is limited as far as duration, quantity, and/or intensity are concerned
= causative action by which humans convey information to other humans
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = process by which humans undergo certain processes or actions initiated by (other) humans or deities
= state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to keep alive|to restore to life
Node.definition: = to cause an object to become or remain alive and well; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in most cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

Node.gloss: to take (one's) eyes off (someone else)|to stop caring
Node.definition: literally: to remove (one's) eyes (from someone else); hence: = action by which humans stop taking care of other humans
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

Node.gloss: to be exalted|to be proud|to be haughty|to be arrogant
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= to be held by someone else, either in a prison or in another situation in which one does not have the freedom to act and go at will; ≈ usually regarded as hardship
= chains or shackles attached to the feet of a captive ► in order to restrain their movements
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

= rope tied into a noose, attached to the other end to a bent bough or small tree that springs upright and tightens the noose around the victim when the trap is sprung; ► used for hunting animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

literally: to make oneself strong; hence: = action by which humans or deities present themselves with boldness to other humans and deities, ≈ which may be good or bad depending on whether this boldness is justified

Node.gloss: to uncover (someone's) ear(s) > to open (someone's) ear(s)
Node.definition: literally: to uncover (someone's) ear(s); hence: = causative action by which a deity enables a human being to hear certain things, as that person's ears had been covered before
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to turn back from|to give up|to retire from
Node.definition: literally: to turn (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans or deities stop being engaged in a certain activity
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity
literally: to finish (one's) days; hence: = action by which people go through the motions of life for a particular amount of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= conditions and circumstances that have qualities that inspire appreciation
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
meaning unsure; possibly: = river that forms the boundary between the world of the living and the world of the dead

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

= causative action by which humans hold other humans under control, either in a prison or in another situation in which that person does not have the freedom to act and go at will; ≈ regarded as hardship
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= always occurs parallel to נֶפֶשׁ ; literally: (someone's) life, though used in such a way that that life represents the entire person who owns it
= man employed to have sexual intercourse with other people as part of local fertility rites; ► forbidden under Mosaic law
= causative action by which deities bring humans out of a dangerous situation
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

Node.gloss: to uncover (someone's) ear(s) > to open (someone's) ear(s)
Node.definition: literally: to uncover (someone's) ear(s); hence: = causative action by which a deity enables a human being to hear certain things, as that person's ears had been covered before
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress

literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= state in which the body of humans or animals contains a significant quantity of fat, ≈ which used to be regarded as the best part and associated with health and well being
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

Node.gloss: to be filled > to be engaged
Node.definition: literally: to be filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which humans are fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant

= the act of giving a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensure that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in vindication for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
exact meaning unknown; probably: = state in which humans have an abundance of goods and feel secure
= a sum of money demanded or paid, either legally or illegally, in exchange for a service, or in exchange for someone's freedom or someone's life

Node.gloss: to cause (others) to turn (from the right way)
Node.definition: literally: to cause (someone) to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = causative action by which humans cause (other) humans to deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else|= state in which humans are wealthy ► and therefore belong to the upper class of the society; ≈ associated with respectability and moral character
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= process by which humans summon their physical strength to accomplish a particular goal
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
literally: to pant after something; hence: = state in which humans wish strongly for something to happen
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
literally: to go up (in smoke); hence: = process by which something disappears from existence ◄ like smoke that goes up and vanishes

Node.gloss: to be careful|to make sure|to take precautions
Node.definition: = action by which humans ensure their own well being by being watchful, by making sure that certain instructions are carried out, or by refraining from certain activities
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events|= action by which someone evaluates the dependability and/or reliability of someone else ◄ as an assayer examines ore or metal
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= someone who imparts knowledge to other people

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to give a command|to issue a decree|to prescribe
Node.definition: = action by which humans give a command to (other) humans or deities
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= action by which humans give expression to their respect for the deeds of a deity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which a deity or object is considered imposing because of certain characteristics and features
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events
= action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which deities remove drops of water from a large body of water
= process by which some element is purged of less pure elements
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive
= body of water; ◄ located both below the earth and in the sky, coming up or down to water the earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
marker affirming or questioning the truth value of the information that follows
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= causative action by which deities cause objects to extend themselves to cover a wide area
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= action by which humans speak loudly

= a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, figuratively God's protection over his people, God's shelter for himself; also a metaphor for Jerusalem, the dwelling of God's people; also by extension, a place where ferocious animals can hide in order to attack someone
literally: to cause to spread out; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans or objects to divide themselves and move into many different directions

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
literally: root; hence: = the bottom part of a certain object
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
literally: to cover; hence: = state in which a certain condition is visible over a very large area

Node.gloss: to judge|to pass judgment|to vindicate|to rule
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensures that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in relief for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= state in which substances are large in quantity
= the inner part of the human hand (יָד) but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
literally: to cover (a substance) over one's hands; hence, probably: = action by which deities grab hold of a certain substance

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= causative action by which deities cause objects to go and reach another object
= the crashing sound during a storm accompanying a flash of lightning
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way|literally: to come up; hence: = state by which an event is about to happen
